title: `!Sized` return type error panics with 'no errors encountered even though `delay_span_bug` issued'

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-stable
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from one stable version to another.

body:
### Code

```Rust
use std::ops::BitOr;

pub trait IntWrapper {
    type InternalStorage;
}

impl<T> BitOr for dyn IntWrapper<InternalStorage = T>
where
    Self: Sized,
    T: BitOr + BitOr<Output = T>,
{
    type Output = Self;
    fn bitor(self, _other: Self) -> Self {
        todo!()
    }
}
```

### Meta
Via [the playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=9957462c94dc83db6ebe95aa9f408f62) on all of stable, beta, and nightly.

> note: rustc 1.48.0 (7eac88abb 2020-11-16) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
> note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C codegen-units=1 -C debuginfo=2 --crate-type lib
> note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden

### Error output

```
   Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
error: internal compiler error: `!Sized` return type
  --> src/lib.rs:13:37
   |
13 |     fn bitor(self, _other: Self) -> Self {
   |                                     ^^^^
   |
   = note: delayed at compiler/rustc_typeck/src/check/check.rs:154:18

thread 'rustc' panicked at 'no errors encountered even though `delay_span_bug` issued', compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:961:13
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace

error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.
```

### Credit
[Discovered by rectang as reported on the user forum](https://users.rust-lang.org/t/bounds-when-implementing-a-trait-for-a-trait/52972).
